info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 03 at 4:16AM MDT until April 05 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. Blowing and drifting of snow will reduce visibility creating near white out conditions. * WHERE...Mainly the western slopes of the Sawtooths but to include Stanley and Galena pass and areas above 6000 feet. * WHEN...From Monday morning through early Monday evening. Snow will be heaviest mid morning through mid to late afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds will likely bring down tree branches and increase avalanche danger.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
